TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataGridSelectionUnit extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines constants that specify whether cells, rows, or both, are used for selection in a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.SelectionMode%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.SelectionUnit%2A> properties together determine how users can select items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid>. For example, if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.SelectionMode%2A> is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridSelectionMode> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid.SelectionUnit%2A> is Cell, the user can select only one cell at a time in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.DataGridSelectionUnit Cell = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Only cells are selectable. Clicking a cell selects the cell. Clicking a row or column header does nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.DataGridSelectionUnit CellOrRowHeader = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Cells and rows are selectable. Clicking a cell selects only the cell. Clicking a row header selects the full row.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.DataGridSelectionUnit FullRow = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Only full rows are selectable. Clicking a cell or a row header selects the full row.
